channel.title: CNN.com - Technology
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: How to outsmart fake news in your Facebook feed
item.description: Fake news is actually really easy to spot -- if you know how. Consider this your New Media Literacy Guide.

item.title: Revealed: Winners of the 'Oscars of watches'
item.description: It's the prize giving ceremony that everyone's on time for.

item.title: Driverless 'Roborace' car makes street track debut
item.description: It is a car kitted out with technology its developers boldly predict will transform our cities and change the way we live.

item.title: Flying a sports car with wings
item.description: Piloting one of the breed of light aircraft is said to be as easy as driving a car

item.title: Brightest supermoon since 1948
item.description: See photos of November's supermoon -- the brightest in nearly 70 years.

item.title: This NASA astronaut voted from space
item.description: From infinity and beyond, he found a way to vote.

item.title: Teen girls prepare for space launch
item.description: Teenage girls have designed Africa's first private satellite due to launch into space in 2017. It's hoped it can monitor and find answers to South Africa's drought crisis.

item.title: Going to space is a real pain in the back
item.description: A six-month stay on the International Space Station can be a pain in the back for astronauts. While they may gain up to 2 inches in height temporarily, that effect is accompanied by a weakening of the muscles supporting the spine, according to a new study.

item.title: Russian gamers race to prevent nuclear 'war'
item.description: "Attention! Attention!" blares the Russian voice from a loudspeaker. "The nuclear bombs will be launched in one hour."

item.title: What parents should know about the VR gear kids want
item.description: Thinking about treating your family to a little virtual reality this holiday? Have no idea where to start? Don't worry. From Google's inexpensive Cardboard VR viewer to Sony's new PlayStation VR, this guide will help you figure out what makes sense for your family's interests, needs and budget.

item.title: Japan's boom in weird wearable tech
item.description: What do Discman, Tamagotchi, and Game Boy have in common?

item.title: Cell phones, screens are keeping your kid awake
item.description: These days, teachers often face classrooms filled with yawning students who stayed up late snapping selfies or playing online games.
